data.title: MarketWatch First Take: Antitrust lawsuits against Google portray the ‘evil' company its founders once cautioned against
data.text: Sixteen years after Google's IPOs, two major antitrust lawsuits filed against it detail a bevy of anticompetitive behavior, painting a powerful and yes, evil, company.

data.title: Facebook, Google Engaged in Anticompetitive Behavior: Mass. AG Healey
data.text: Dec.17 -- On Wednesday, Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton filed an antitrust lawsuit against Alphabet Inc.'s Google, alleging Google colluded with archrival Facebook Inc. in an illegal deal to manipulate auctions for online advertising, Massachusetts Attorney General Maura Healey discusses the case on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: Google Approved By EU To Acquire Fitbit
data.text: Even amid a crackdown on tech acquisitions, Google has managed to win European Union approval for its $2.1 billion purchase of fitness tracker Fitbit, according to Bloomberg. The move comes as regulators in the EU are looking at ways to keep U.S. Big Tech companies from over-extending their dominance of the markets.

data.title: Google hit with 3rd antitrust lawsuit since October
data.text: Yahoo Finance's Dan Howley reports on the lawsuit filed against Google over alleged antitrust violations. #Google #BigTech #YahooFinance For 2020 election results please visit: Election results: https://www.yahoo.com/elections Subscribe to Yahoo Finance: https://yhoo.it/2fGu5Bb About Yahoo Finance: At Yahoo Finance, you get free stock quotes, up-to-date news, portfolio management resources, international market data, social interaction and mortgage rates that help you manage your financial life.

data.title: Google Wins EU Antitrust Approval For $2.1B Fitbit Deal: Report
data.text: Alphabet Inc's (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google has received European Union antitrust approval for its $2.1-billion — or $7.35 per share in cash — acquisition of Fitbit Inc (NYSE: FIT) after agreeing to limit how it would use the health data of its customers, according to a Reuters report. Google's plan to acquire Fitbit, which supplies fitness trackers and smartwatches, has been attracting criticism from privacy advocates.

data.title: Alphabet health company Verily bolsters warchest with another $700 million
data.text: It comes nearly a year after a $1 billion investment round led by Silver Lake.

data.title: Google Slapped With Antitrust Lawsuit Filed By Coalition Of 38 States
data.text: A coalition of 38 state attorneys general filed an antitrust lawsuit against Google, accusing the search giant of engaging in anti-competitive practices, the Associated Press (AP) reported on Thursday (Dec. 17). The federal lawsuit was filed in Washington, D.C.

data.title: 38 states band together in antitrust suit against Google
data.text: 38 states band together in antitrust suit against Google for monopolizing search. Subscribe to Fox Business!

data.title: Google faces its third antitrust lawsuit
data.text: CNBC's Deirdre Bosa reports Google is facing its third antitrust lawsuit from 38 states.

data.title: Google says looks forward to defending self in court
data.text: Search and advertising giant Google said on Thursday that it looked forward to defending itself in court after a third major antitrust lawsuit was filed against it.

data.title: Google wins EU antitrust approval for $2B Fitbit deal
data.text: Google won EU antitrust approval on Thursday for its $2.1 billion bid for Fitbit after agreeing to restrictions on how it will use customers' health-related data. The deal had triggered criticism from privacy advocates on both sides of the Atlantic, consumer organizations and Google rivals about the company's market power and the use of people's.

data.title: Google hit by antitrust lawsuit from nearly 40 states over alleged search monopoly
data.text: The search giant is now facing three major antitrust lawsuits.

data.title: Europe Clears Google's $2.1 Billion Deal for Fitbit. So Long as It Follows These Rules.
data.text: The approval comes after a monthslong investigation over concerns about the acquisition's effect on Google's market position in the European Economic Area.

data.title: The antitrust lawsuits against Google just keep coming
data.text: Google is now facing its third antitrust lawsuit.

data.title: New York is co-leading a third blockbuster antitrust suit against Google
data.text: Google on Thursday was hit with a third regulatory lawsuit over its market dominance, this time from 38 states and territories led by New York, Colorado and Nebraska.  The suit accuses Google of maintaining monopolies through “multiple forms of anticompetitive conduct in the general search and search advertising-related markets.

data.title: Google slammed for ‘monopoly power' in new antitrust lawsuit from 35 states
data.text: Another day, another major antitrust effort seeking to dismantle the unprecedented power of the world's biggest tech companies. On Thursday, a group of 38 attorneys general announced a bipartisan lawsuit against Google, alleging the company has engaged in “illegal, anticompetitive conduct” to create a monopoly in search and search advertising.

data.title: Google Hit With Another Antitrust Lawsuit As 35 States Challenge Search Practices
data.text: Google was hit with another antitrust lawsuit on Thursday, as 35 states other other U.S. territories claim that the internet giant has stifled competition in its dominance of web search. “As the gateway to the internet, Google has systematically degraded the ability of other companies to access consumers,” the lawsuit states. “In doing so, just...

data.title: More than 30 US states sue Google in third antitrust action of the autumn
data.text: Complaint targets Google's search business and claims company uses exclusionary deals to dominate newer tech

data.title: Google urged to vet online financial promotions better
data.text: Google should voluntarily take action immediately to better vet paid-for promotions for financial products, Britain's Financial Conduct Authority said on Thursday after a damning report on the watchdog's handling of a collapsed fund.

data.title: Google hit with yet another antitrust suit, this one focused on core search engine
data.text: Google was hit with a second multistate antitrust lawsuit in two days Thursday, with the most recent claiming the company altered the designs of its search engine to undercut competitors.

data.title: Google hit with third antitrust lawsuit as more than 30 U.S. states sue
data.text: A group of U.S. state attorneys general including Colorado and 34 other states filed an antitrust complaint against Alphabet Inc's Google on Thursday, marking the third lawsuit against the online search and advertising company this fall.

data.title: Google hit with its third antitrust lawsuit since October by bipartisan coalition of states
data.text: The Justice Department filed suit against Google in October alongside 11 Republican state AGs.

data.title: Google's Legal Peril Grows in Face of Third Antitrust Suit
data.text: More than 30 states said that the company downplayed websites that let users search for information in specialized areas.

data.title: Google's Fitbit acquisition finally wins European approval
data.text: Alphabet Inc.'s Google finally obtained approval from the European Commission to acquire Fitbit Inc., after satisfying concerns about how the advertising giant would make use of health data obtained through the deal.

data.title: Microsoft's Lessons for Google
data.text: What the Microsoft case teaches us about antitrust and the power of Big Tech today.

data.title: Google and Twitter are primed to rally as economic reopening boosts online ad spending, Bank of America says
data.text: Some tech giants will rally further through the global economic recovery as ad spending sharply rebounds, according to Bank of America. Economic recovery is largely expected to leave tech giants on the sideline while cyclical and value stocks outperform. Yet Bank of America sees Google and Twitter as top beneficiaries of increased ad spending, and is forecasting strong gains for the names through the first half of 2021.

data.title: Google's $2.1 billion acquisition of Fitbit cleared by EU regulators after key concessions
data.text: The European Union has approved Google's $2.1 billion acquisition of Fitbit after securing concessions from the tech giant, including preventing it from using users' health data for advertising purposes.

data.title: FTC competition director on Big Tech antitrust scrutiny
data.text: CNBC's "Squawk Alley" team is joined by Ian Conner, the FTC's Bureau of Competition director, to break down Big Tech antitrust concerns.

data.title: Alphabet's Verily raises $700 million in funding round
data.text: Alphabet Inc's life sciences division, Verily Life Sciences LLC, said it raised $700 million in a funding round from its investors including Alphabet, Silver Lake and Temasek.

data.title: What Will Drive the Next Leg of Growth for FAANG Stocks in 2021?
data.text: The FAANG stocks -- AMZN, AAPL, NFLX, FB & GOOGL -- are expected to maintain momentum in 2021 based on rapid adoption of 5G and expansion into growth markets like India.

data.title: Facebook (FB), Google Accused of Illegal Ad Deal by US States
data.text: Facebook (FB) woes mount as the antitrust probe with Google over ad revenues comes at a time when the company is dealing with the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

data.text: Google will compete with Apple, Garmin and Samsung.

data.title: Why this tech analyst says investors may consolidate their tech trades in 2021
data.text: CNBC's "Squawk on the Street" team discusses the tech sector and the growth that the Nasdaq Composite has seen in 2020 with lead tech analyst Mark Mahaney of RBC Capital Markets.

data.title: Google a better vaccine recovery stock than Facebook in first half of 2021, Bank of America says
data.text: Bank of America analysts see Google's stock as the bigger recovery stock than online ad peer Facebook in the first half of 2021.

data.title: Europe clears Google-Fitbit with a ten-year ban on using health data for ads
data.text: Europe has greenlit Google's $2.1BN acquisition of fitness wearable maker Fitbit, applying a number of conditions intended to shrink competition concerns over letting it gobble a major cache of health and wellness data following months of regulatory scrutiny of the deal. While Google announced its plan to buy Fitbit over a year ago, it only […]

data.title: Google's $2.1 billion Fitbit acquisition wins conditional EU approval
data.text: It comes after the European Commission investigated the search giant's promise not to use health data for targeting ads.

data.title: EU antitrust regulators clear $2.1 billion Google, Fitbit deal
data.text: EU antitrust regulators on Thursday approved with conditions Alphabet unit Google's $2.1 billion bid for Fitbit after the world's most popular internet search engine pledged not to hinder rivals and also not to use Fitbit's health data for its advertising.

data.title: Google's $2.1 billion acquisition of Fitbit conditionally approved by European Commission
data.text: Google's $2.1 billion acquisition of Fitbit has been approved by the European Commission, the executive arm of the EU.

data.title: DeepMind A.I. unit lost $649 million last year and had a $1.5 billion debt waived by Alphabet
data.text: DeepMind made a loss of £477 million ($649 million) in 2019, up from £470 million in 2018, according to documents filed with the U.K.'s Companies House.

data.title: Google could already have been broken up under strict EU plans for Big Tech: 'What matters is enforcement'
data.text: The EU could have forcibly broken Google up by now if strict new proposals on tech regulation had already been in place, experts say.  On Tuesday, Ursula von Der Leyen, president of the European Commission, unveiled the first draft of the Digital Services Act and the Digital Markets Act, which – while still a way off being imposed – could in time have serious implications for Big Tech.

data.title: Facebook and Google have been accused of striking a secret, illegal advertising deal
data.text: Google struck an illegal, under-the-table deal with Facebook, a coalition of state attorneys general have said. The coalition, led by Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, on Wednesday filed an antitrust lawsuit against Google. The suit accuses Google of unfairly leveraging monopoly power in its adtech business.

data.title: 10 U.S. states accuse Google of working with Facebook to break antitrust law and boost ads business
data.text: Texas and nine other states sued Google on Wednesday, accusing it of working with Facebook in an unlawful manner.

data.title: Google's AI ethics team makes demands of executives to 'rebuild trust'
data.text: It comes after executives admitted to losing the trust of employees amid the departure of renowned researcher Timnit Gebru.

data.title: Google expands languages push in India to serve non-English speakers
data.text: There are over 600 million internet users in India, but only a fraction of this population is fluent in English. Most online services and much of the content on the web currently, however, are available exclusively in English.
